alert.note: Alert for Delta (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:51AM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction affecting Delta County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt continuing to increase. Flows in rivers are increasing quickly and reaching critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Nahma Junction. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water floods low lying areas along the river. This may include...parts of the Flowing Well Campground downstream of gauge site and the tenmile rapids canoe launch upstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.98 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 04/30/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking or biking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EDT.
